column5: So, let me see if I've got this straight - Richard Peddie, President and CEO of Maple Leaf Sports & Entertainment, is accusing the Toronto Mayoral candidates of having no vision. Riiiight... Mr. Pot, meet Mr. Kettle. How's that Stanley Cup plan coming along Richard?

Dave. What do you think about our government investing in Sports franchises. Do you think they are a solid investment? Especially when it comes to the NFL where all the revenue is split even. It is a win, win situation for the provinces and the tax payers AND the fans.  http://ca.news.yahoo.com/s/capress/100914/national/hkn_nordiques_arena  Would you support Ontario's premier for investing all(prefered) if not a portion?  I don't think the gov should give money away. They should own shares and that even if the sports facility is not for all the public? The profits generated from it would be beneficial for the entire public.
Here here!  Bettman is the leading bottom feeding maggot of Professional Sports!    Ab

You're posing financial questions to a guy who couldn't balance a checkbook to save his life. I am generally against such things, but if there is some sort of guarantee that the investment is returned (pretty hard to do) then I wouldn't object.
